Topic.Title: March 31st is a big date for Yahoo, I am sure the decision is already made....I just have no idea who it may be!

Message.Msg: "...YHOO search is a huge revenue generator." That statement suggests that the Yahoo search engine (oh wait, that's gone - umm BING) is a product that clients/partners/companies pay to use...I DON'T THINK SO. The correct statement is "ADS linked to YHOO search (yah, that BING thing we use)" is a huge revenue generator". Yahoo only had its own search engine from 2003 to 2009 and unless they've secretly spent the last 3-1/2 rebuilding it for the modern world they STILL will need a search engine partner (just like other media companies do).

Topic.Title: Will Yahoo Keep Their Current Search Deal with Microsoft?

Message.Msg: Pity they didn't spend some of the billions on bringing what was once their own search engine(s) up to the demands of the modern era. I suspect GOOG still owns all of Mayer's artificial intelligence and search creativity so the CEO can't just apply her technology...pity indeed.

Topic.Title: Raymond James initiates coverage on Yahoo! with a Outperform and a PT of $26.00.

Message.Msg: "When Lui took over the CEO, YHOO will be at least trading at $26 or mid-range of $20s. I think we will see trading in the $30's once MM and her turnaround team get YHOO out of the bottom." So which is it "at least $26 or mid range $20's"? Also, could you expand on the "turn around team"? Who are they? Experience? And last look Yahoo is still at the bottom even with "MM and her turnaround team" Finally, why would Lui help Yahoo stock? Oh yeah the IPO than has never been announced. And those investment bankers that were being picked (yet denied by the company. And th)at Yahoo/Facebook thing never materialized. Jack Ma stepping down is somehow good? Mark Zuckerberg stepping aside at Facebook would have been good as well? Steve Jobs at Apple? IF the grand plan was for Ma to step aside for the IPO wouldn't they have announced that as well? A lot of folks here are hanging their hat on a lot of opium that so far has yet to materialize. The next dissappointment will be when Yahoo annouces that they are continuing their deal with Microsoft . Yahoo is not the company it once was and its only value, at least at these lofty levels relies heavily on the value of its holdings in Alibaba and Yahoo Japan. Both of which are no closer to being done than they were 2 months ago.....and if things get worse globally...the share price will fall like its share of search has over the last few years.

Message.Title: Yahoo in talks with DailyMotion
Message.Msg: Love this...Mayer wanted videos. There you go.

Message.Title: Yahoo! in talks for 75% stake in France Telecom's Dailymotion, WSJ reports
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc. is in discussions to buy a controlling stake in the Dailymotion video streaming site from France Telecom SA, according to a report by the Wall Street Journal on Tuesday afternoon. Citing unnamed sources, the report said Yahoo may buy a 75% stake in the site, which could fetch a total valuation of around $300 million. It would be the first major acquisition since Marissa Mayer took over the CEO job at Yahoo last year. The deal could bolster Yahoo's presence in the online video market outside the U.S. Shares of Yahoo were flat in after-hours trades on Tuesday following the report.
